intro: Verbesina barrancae, commonly known as the Barranca goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Verbesina barrancae is often found in disturbed soils and along canyon walls.
